free_text.Learning outcomes: - Students will be able to modelize the electronic properties of semiconductors[br/]- They will be able to explain the fonctionnal behavior of basic microelectronic devices like Schottky and p/n diodes, bipolar transistors, FET and MOSFET's[br/]- They will be able to develop physical models adapted to each device and to analyze their characteristics[br/]- They will derive the fundamental equations and will known haw to simiplify them in order to permit an easy application[br/]They will discuss the main electronic circuits, as well analogical as digital ones, by applying the physical models.
free_text.Content: [b]Electronic properties of Silicon[/b][br/]Band structure, carrier statistics. Transport properties, mobility, lifetime, diffusion length. Recombination. Continuity equations.[br/][b]Junction diode and metal-semiconductor contacts[/b][br/]p-n junction under equilibrium and applied bias.[br/]Current-voltage characteristics. Barrier potentials. Junction capacitance. Ohmic contacts.[br/][b]Bipolar transistor[/b][br/]Intrinsic transistor model. Current-voltage characteristics. Large signal and small signal models. [br/][b]Field effect transistors[/b][br/]JFET, MESFET structures. Principles and basic equations.[br/][b]Metal-oxide-semiconductor structures[/b][br/]Interface band diagrams. Accumulation, depletion and inversion regimes. Capacitance-voltage characteristics. Charge-coupled devices.[br/][b]MOS transistors[/b][br/]Current-voltage characteristics in strong inversion. Non-volatile memories. Linear and saturation regions.[br/][b]Introduction to integrated circuits[/b][br/]Digital circuits: inverter, NOR, OR, switching time, dissipation. Analogue circuits: analogue switch, current source, differential amplifier. Comparison of semiconductor devices.[br/]
